definition: no one to rely on (idiom); on one's own/orphaned/left to one's own devices
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to lean against or on/to stand by the side of/to come near to/to depend on/to trust/to fuck (vulgar)/traditional military costume drama where the performers wear armor (old)

sentences.english: I found myself homeless and alone.
sentences.chinese: 我发先自己无依无靠，无家可归。

sentences.english: But I am helpless, traveled alone, and only dream is my only companion.
sentences.chinese: 可我无依无靠，踽踽独行，只有梦是我唯一的伴侣。

sentences.english: The child's feeling of insecurity was caused by his mother's early death .
sentences.chinese: 这孩子无依无靠的感觉是由于他母亲早死所造成的。

sentences.english: Kite sometimes break line, like helpless child.
sentences.chinese: 风筝有时还会断线，象无依无靠的孩子。

definition: solitary and impoverished (idiom)
to look up and see no-one familiar (idiom); not having anyone to rely on/without a friend in the world
variant of 孤苦伶仃[gu1 ku3 ling2 ding1]
to have lost both one's parents
to lodge under another person's roof (idiom); to live relying on sb else's charity
to be all alone in the world
homeless
mutually dependent for life (idiom); to rely upon one another for survival/interdependent
to wander far from home
orphan
bleak/miserable
to be without a fixed residence (idiom)
one who is cut off from others (idiom)/one who has chosen to follow a solitary path/(can also be an indirect way of referring to an unmarried person)
to be orphaned of one's father
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
without relatives or friends
